config.taskName: Added label auto closes issue with reason

parameters.comment:
This issue will be closed because we only accept document content feedback in this repository's issue list. This issues list is not intended for service issues, questions, or service feedback.

If you have service issues and want to raise a support request, and if one of the following applies:
- You are an administrator of an active Azure subscription - raise a new technical support ticket at the **[Azure Admin Center](https://ms.portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Support/HelpAndSupportBlade/newsupportreq)**.
- You are an administrator of an Office 365 or Microsoft 365 tenant - raise a new service request using the **Support** menu in the **[Microsoft 365 Admin Center](https://admin.microsoft.com)**.

If you would like to ask a question about Microsoft Graph, please visit [Microsoft Q&A](https://aka.ms/askGraph). 

If you have suggestions or feedback on Microsoft Graph, please visit [Microsoft Tech Community](https://aka.ms/graphfeedback).

If you are looking to provide feedback or raise issues on Microsoft Graph SDKs, please visit the [respective Github repo](https://github.com/microsoftgraph?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=sdk&type=&language=).

config.taskName: Auto close non docs.microsoft.com submitted issues

parameters.comment:
This issue will be closed because we do not support feedback captured directly from the GitHub new issue page. Also, this issues list is not intended for service issues, questions, or service feedback.

To provide feedback on [Microsoft Graph documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview), please scroll to the **Feedback** section at the bottom of the related documentation page. You can click **This page** and create new feedback there. This gives the team the necessary context of your feedback.

If you have service issues and want to raise a support request, and if one of the following applies:
- You are an administrator of an active Azure subscription - raise a new technical support ticket at the **[Azure Admin Center](https://ms.portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Support/HelpAndSupportBlade/newsupportreq)**.
- You are an administrator of an Office 365 or Microsoft 365 tenant - raise a new service request using the **Support** menu in the **[Microsoft 365 Admin Center](https://admin.microsoft.com)**.

If you would like to ask a question about Microsoft Graph, please visit [Microsoft Q&A](https://aka.ms/askGraph). 

If you have suggestions or feedback on Microsoft Graph, please visit [Microsoft Tech Community](https://aka.ms/graphfeedback).

If you are looking to provide feedback or raise issues on Microsoft Graph SDKs, please visit the [respective Github repo](https://github.com/microsoftgraph?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=sdk&type=&language=).

config.taskName: Lock closed issues
Flag un-flagged pull requests with Do Not Merge

parameters.comment:
Thanks for your pull request, ${issueAuthor}! I've added the **do not merge** label as a default status. 

Please add the **ready for content review** label to start a review. Your PR won't be reviewed until you add this label.

After the content review is complete and the updates in this PR are ready for external customers to use, please replace the **do not merge** label with **ready to merge**.

**Note:** Pull requests will not be merged until the **ready to merge** label is set.

For details, see the [Content review process summary](https://dev.azure.com/msazure/One/_wiki/wikis/Microsoft%20Graph%20Partners/211773/Content-workflow).

config.taskName: Flag pull requests from contributors
Flag pull requests from community

parameters.comment: Thanks for your contribution ${issueAuthor}! Please see [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/microsoftgraph/microsoft-graph-docs/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for guidelines.

config.taskName: Mark inactive do not merge pull requests

parameters.comment:
This PR has been automatically marked as stale because it has been labeled "do not merge" but has not had any activity for **60 days**. It will be closed if no further activity occurs **within 7 days of this comment**.

If you still intend to merge this pull request eventually, please add a comment to keep this open, and update the status labels accordingly.

config.taskName: Remove no recent activity from pull requests
Remove no recent activity from pull requests if author comments
Close inactive pull requests
Close stale issues

parameters.comment: This issue has been closed due to inactivity. If the issue is still present, please provide the requested information to reopen the issue.

config.taskName: Remove no recent activity label when an issue is commented on
Close expired pull requests
When pr-expired label applied, warn that issue will be closed

parameters.comment:
@${issueAuthor}, in an effort to better serve our documentation contributors, we are auditing all long-running open pull requests. This pull request has been identified as having no recent activity and being opened prior to 2021. To keep our docs review team focused on active requests, **we will close this pull request in 24 hours**.

If the changes you submitted in this pull request are no longer relevant or needed, no action is required. If these changes are still needed, please take one of the following actions.

- Reopen this pull request, resolve all merge conflicts, address all review comments, and set the `ready for content review` label ASAP to request a review from our team.
- Create a new pull request and reimplement your changes against the current state of the repository.

Thanks!
Microsoft Graph Docs Team

config.taskName: When ready for content review label is added, add to editorial project

parameters.comment:
Thank you for indicating that your pull request is ready for content review, @${issueAuthor}. It has been added to the **Content Review** project and an available reviewer will be assigned in the next 15 business days, depending on demand. You can monitor the status of your pull request in the editorial process [here](https://github.com/orgs/microsoftgraph/projects/15).

Check the content review workflow [here](https://dev.azure.com/msazure/One/_wiki/wikis/Microsoft%20Graph%20Partners/211773/Content-workflow?anchor=content-review-process-summary).

parameters.projectName: Microsoft Graph Docs Content Review Queue

config.taskName: When content review complete label added, move to Complete column

parameters.projectName: Microsoft Graph Docs Content Review Queue

parameters.comment:
Thank you for your work in this PR, @${issueAuthor}. 

When the updates in this PR are ready for external customers to use, please replace the **do not merge** label with **ready to merge**.

Check the content review workflow [here](https://dev.azure.com/msazure/One/_wiki/wikis/Microsoft%20Graph%20Partners/211773/Content-workflow?anchor=content-review-process-summary).

config.taskName: When changes requested label is added, assign to author and move to the Changes requested column

parameters.comment:
@${issueAuthor}, your content reviewer has requested changes to your pull request. Please review feedback and address accordingly as soon as possible to keep your pull request moving forward. 

Once you have addressed the feedback, please add the `review feedback addressed` label and select the **Re-request review** icon. 

If you cannot add labels, please add a comment with `#feedback-addressed` to the pull request.

Check the content review workflow [here](https://dev.azure.com/msazure/One/_wiki/wikis/Microsoft%20Graph%20Partners/211773/Content-workflow?anchor=content-review-process-summary).

parameters.projectName: Microsoft Graph Docs Content Review Queue

config.taskName: When the review feedback addressed label is added, move to the Ready for review column

parameters.projectName: Microsoft Graph Docs Content Review Queue

config.taskName: When pull request is closed, remove from Editorial queue

parameters.projectName: Microsoft Graph Docs Content Review Queue

config.taskName: Add feedback addressed label if author comments #feedback-addressed

parameters.projectName: Microsoft Graph Docs Content Review Queue

config.taskName: When the content review in progress label is added, move to the In review column

parameters.projectName: Microsoft Graph Docs Content Review Queue
